title: Could Jenny Ryan win X Factor: Celebrity? Judges shocked at Queen cover
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

The Chase’s Jenny Ryan has shocked us all with her secret singing voice.

Appearing on The X Factor: Celebrity, the 37-year-old blasted out her very own rendition of Queen’s Somebody To Love.

And while she is no Freddie Mercury, or even George Michael in this case, the quiz master gave it her best shot – and we must say, we’re impressed.

Unlike Rami Malek, who mimed his way through the Queen biopic Bohemian Rhapsody, Jenny managed to hit every note and could potentially take the crown in this year’s competition.

Advertisement

Advertisement

When appearing on the stage, The Vixon trolled Simon Cowell, before revealing the reason she entered the show.

Could Jenny Ryan be The X Factor: Celebrity winner (Picture: Rex)

‘I’m a professional crusher of dreams,’ the star said when explaining her role on The Chase: ‘So Simon and I have a lot in common already.’

Jenny went on: ‘It has taken all of my 20s and most of my 30s to get to this point where I am very happy with who I am.

‘Part of that was discovering the power of music, it brings me such joy, it’s a time for me to try and share what I’ve got with the world.’

And she sure brought the joy, as the judges were left more than excited by her performance.

She was a far cry away from her usual (Picture: ITV)

The judges were impressed (Picture: PA)

After giving the contestant a standing ovation, Louis Walsh said: ‘Wow, Jenny where did all that come from? You have just got a great voice.’

And he wasn’t on his own with that opinion, as Nicole Scherzinger added: ‘Jenny, you were like, “I don’t really care y’all… Welcome to my back garden.”’

She laughed: ‘To know that you’re like a human encyclopaedia or whatever – when you opened your face hole and that came out, I was like, “yeah!”’

In her VT before her live performance, Jenny said: ‘When I was asked to come on the show, I thought, “Wow what an opportunity,” I love singing with my little ukulele and I thought, “Let’s see what Simon thinks.”‘

Advertisement

Advertisement

She continued: ‘The pop industry right now is really exciting, possibly there’s a space there for a geeky quizzer popstar… who knows? I would buy her album.’

The X Factor: Celebrity kicks off tonight at 8.35pm on ITV.

description: Could Jenny Ryan win X Factor: Celebrity? Judges impressed by The Chase star's Queen rendition.
